customerId.description: Unique identifier for the customer associated with the alert, if available.

subprovider.description: Specific sub-provider within the provider service.

alertType.description: Type of alert, e.g., FRAUD, DISPUTE.

currency.description: Currency code in ISO format (e.g., USD, EUR) for the transaction.

invoicedAt.description: Date and time when the alert was invoiced.

alertId.description: Unique identifier for the alert within the provider's system. Will match the id field.

creditStatus.description: Status of the credit (if any) associated with the alert.

transactionDate.description: Date and time when the transaction took place.

descriptor.description: Billing descriptor shown on the card statement.

amount.description: Transaction amount for the alert. $139.38 will be represented as 139.38

externalOrder.description: External charge id related to the alert.

reasonCode.description: Reason code associated with the alert, often indicating the nature of the dispute.

creditAppealed.description: Indicates if the credit associated with the alert was appealed.

provider.description: Provider associated with the alert. Possible values: ethoca, verifi

authCode.description: Authorization code for the transaction, if available.

arn.description: Acquirer Reference Number, unique identifier for the transaction.

resolvedByApi.description: Indicates if the alert was resolved via API.

issuer.description: Issuer of the card (e.g., bank or financial institution).

acquirerAction.description: Actions taken by the acquirer in response to the alert. Only relevant for RDR and other acquirer side alerts - either Resolved or Declined.

creditNotes.description: Additional notes or information regarding the credit status.

externalUrl.description: URL linking to an external reference for the alert.

createdAt.description: Date and time when the alert was created.

site.description: Merchant's website or site string associated with the alert.

responseAction.description: Response action taken in response to the alert.

resolvedDate.description: Date and time when the alert was resolved.

customerEmail.description: Customer's email address associated with the alert, if available.

merchantId.description: Identifier for the merchant within the system.

cardBrand.description: The card network (e.g., Visa, Mastercard, Amex).

post.description: Update the state of an alert to properly inform the banks of whether or not a refund will be issued. If an alert is left unactioned for 72 hours it will be automatically declined. For best results mark alerts as resolved within 24 hours of receiving them (some smaller banks will escalate quarantined transactions as soon as 24 hours within propogating an alert). If you attempt to update an already actioned alert, the request will fail.

get.description: Get an individual merchant from your chargeblast account.

post.description: Enroll the merchant in a various alert program. If no merchant_id is specified a new merchant object will be automatically generated. For each alert program various info is required. For example, for Ethoca, only descriptors are. To see which info is required see [here](https://docs.chargeblast.io/reference/enrollment-criteria)

get.description: Get all the alerts from your chargeblast account.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The starting page of the request. Default value of 0.
How many objects to request per page. Default value of 10.
parameters.name: per

get.description: Get all the alerts from your chargeblast account.
Get all the alerts from your chargeblast account.

post.description: Pass in a given descriptor_id to unenroll merchant's descriptor. Ethoca alerts take 48 hours to confirm unenrollment, RDR ~2 weeks, CDRN ~24 hours.

get.description: Get all the merchants from your chargeblast account.
Fetch all the descriptors for your merchants.

post.description: Upload orders to the chargeblast system. This will allow you to match disputes and chargebacks to the orders you have uploaded. Amount should be in cents, e.g. $19.99 => amount = 1999
